byline.contributor: Alexander Burns reported from Charleston, S.C., and Nate Schweber from New Jersey.
byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and NATE SCHWEBER

abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie faces challenge of returning to state where voters disapproved of his bid to secure Republican presidential nomination after failing to draw enough support in early primaries; it is unclear if Christie has much political capital left, and he is expected to have to confront again George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Christie must now cram his vast political ambitions back into a space the size of New Jersey, and reimmerse himself in the humdrum functions of his office.

headline.main: His Star Faded, Chris Christie Faces the Challenge of a More Modest Political Stage
headline.print_headline: His Star Faded, Christie Returns to More Modest Political Stage

snippet: Mr. Christie must now cram his vast political ambitions back into a space the size of New Jersey, and reimmerse himself in the humdrum functions of his office.
